intro: Labramia boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's labramia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in parts of Cuba and Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
